components.description:
Two parallel lengths of silver chain. Occasionally used as an icon before a hyperlink or for metaphorical connections or chains, e.g., slang off the chains.

Samsung’s design previously featured stylized, white chains in a blue square, as a sign or icon for snow chains for winter driving.

Not to be confused with üîó Link, üìé Paperclip, üñáÔ∏è Linked Paperclips, or üß∑ Safety Pin.
components.title: Chains

Samsung’s design previously featured stylized, white chains in a blue square, as a sign or icon for snow chains for winter driving.

Not to be confused with üîó Link, üìé Paperclip, üñáÔ∏è Linked Paperclips, or üß∑ Safety Pin.
title: Chains

version.description:
Unicode 5.2 pre-dated emoji inclusion in Unicode by one year, and included many characters primarily sourced from the ARIB set of Japanese broadcasting symbols.

The following characters were among those added to Unicode in 2009, several of which were given emoji presentation status in the years 2010-2015.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols -> Traffic sign from ARIB STD B24
emoji_net_data.definition: Chains was approved as part of Unicode 5.2 in 2009 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015. Copy and paste this emoji: Copy http://emojipedia.org/chains/
emoji_net_data.name: chains

bn:00084749v: To fasten or secure with chains.
To fasten something with a chain.

bn:00946750n: The act of depriving a person of his or her liberty usually in relation to the purported investigation or prevention of crime and presenting to a procedure as part of the criminal justice system.
Act of arresting a criminal, suspect etc.
The action of police or other authority to apprehend and take under guard a person who is suspected of committing a crime
The act of arresting a criminal, suspect etc.

An arrest is the act of depriving a person of their liberty usually in relation to the purported investigation or prevention of crime and presenting to a procedure as part of the criminal justice system.

bn:00051771n: Something used for fastening, which can only be opened with a key or combination.
A fastener fitted to a door or drawer to keep it firmly closed
A lock is a mechanical or electronic fastening device that is released by a physical object, by supplying secret information, or by a combination thereof.

bn:00017487n: A chain is a series of connected links which are typically made of metal.
One element of a chain or other connected series.
A series of things depending on each other as if linked together
A series of links united; a series or order of things depending on each other, as if linked together; a chain, a succession.
A mathematical operation that combines two vectors
The state of being linked together as in a chain.
In mathematics, concatenation is the joining of two numbers by their numerals.

apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the chains emoji presents as two interlocking links rendered in a realistic metallic gray with subtle highlights that suggest a polished, weighty material. The realistic lighting and smooth gradients on Apple's design give the chains a tactile, three-dimensional appearance, conveying a sense of being bound, restricted, or connected. It's often used metaphorically to express a feeling of being held back or strongly linked to something.
